messages.title: Tri Uchelgais: Naw Cam Ymlaen i Chi, i Ddwyreini Casnewydd ac i Gymru
messages.content: Three Ambitions: Nine Steps Forward for You, Newport East and for Wales

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A Well Wales: A Cure and Care NHS
keyPolicies.policyDescription: National Commitment on Cancer: 28 day diagnosis by investing in an additional 1000 doctors and 5000 nurses to tackle long cancer waiting times. To abolish home care charges for the elderly and people with dementia.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A Well-Educated Wales: Cradle to Career Education
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Free universal preschool care for children from 3 years of age. Additional support for teachers. Paying trainees and students who choose courses in STEM or Welsh £18,000 to get better quality teachers. Creation of 50,000 new apprenticeships.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A Wealthier Wales: Building our Economic Engine
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Major investment in transport, energy and green infrastructure. A WDA for the 21st century to sell products and ideas to the wider world. Cut business rates and give more public contracts to Welsh firms.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Stopping the proposed £1+ billion M4 Relief road and supporting the cheaper alternative. The well-placed residents of the Varteg Hill to express local business for Newport.

issues.economy: Major investment in our transport, energy and green infrastructure. A WDA for the 21st century to sell products and ideas to the wider world.
issues.education: Free universal preschool care for children from 3 years of age.
issues.health: National Commitment on Cancer: 28 day diagnosis by investing in an additional 1000 doctors and 5000 nurses to tackle long cancer waiting times.
issues.socialWelfare: To abolish home care charges for the elderly and people with dementia.

leaflet.personalStatement: Plaid Cymru is campaigning on putting the communities in the NHS, having 1000 more doctors and 5000 nurses to cut waiting lists and on scrapping home care charges.
leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet emphasizes stopping the proposed £1+ billion M4 Relief road and supporting the cheaper alternative. It pledges to build a stronger economy and improve health and education.
